title: Issue with spack on Tianhe-2 supercomputer in China

labels.name: download-error
labels.description: The package source cannot be downloaded

body:
When I try to use spack to install netcdf on our own servers and Tianhe-2 supercomputer, it shows that the servers cannot resolve  Spack mirrors. I think it may be because of the network of servers. I also contacted with the engineer of Tianhe-2, he told me that they directly install library instead of using spack which is not very useful because of the complexity of supercomputer cluster. 

The errors are as follows:


h 
[blsc407@lon12%tianhe2-B ~]$ spack install netcdf-fortran 
==> Installing libsigsegv
==> Searching for binary cache of libsigsegv
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for libsigsegv found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.11.tar.gz
curl: (6) Couldn't resolve host 'ftpmirror.gnu.org'
==> Fetching from https://ftpmirror.gnu.org/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.11.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for libsigsegv-2.11-xqiyghtlms7lwgexu3wh7zdtbw6lnytl

/PARA/blsc407/spack-develop/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1051, in do_fetch:
       1048                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
       1049                                 self.spec.format('{name}{@version}'), ck_msg)
       1050
  >>   1051        self.stage.create()
       1052        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
       1053        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
